text: The Arakan Army is the military wing (or part) of the United League of Arakan (ULA). The Arakan Army is a branch (or section) of the United League of Arakan Armed Forces. The Arakan Secretary of the Army, a civilian, leads the army with the help of the Army Chief of Staff, a general. Members of an army are called soldiers. When people join the army, they must serve for a certain amount of time called a "tour of duty". A new soldier or recruit goes through Basic Training at a training camp to become a soldier. Each soldier is trained in weapons and equipment that they will operate to carry out missions. Category:Myanmar
title: Arakan Soldiers
